item.title: Gifts
item.description:
Please don’t feel obliged to give us a gift.

But, if you would like to, we would welcome anything hard-wearing, long-lasting, and well-made.

We are a fan of retailers such as:

  • Borough Kitchen
  • Divertimenti
  • Choosing Keeping
  • Liberty
  • Niwaki
  • Labour and Wait

Back to homepage

item.title: On the Day
item.description:
Ceremony

Our Ceremony is being held at St James’ Church, Cherhill, Calne, Wiltshire, SN11 8UZ

Please arrive in ample time for the ceremony at 15:00

The Church does not have any toilets, but feel free to use the toilets at our reception venue at any time - it is only a two minute walk from the Church.

Guests are welcome to wear whatever they’d like, but looking smart and sharp is preferred.

item.title: RSVP
item.description:
If you’ve received an invitation, please let us know whether you can make it before Sunday 27th April.

Let us know if you have any dietary or access requirements and we’ll do our best to ensure we meet your needs.

Our contact details are on the invitation, but feel free to get in touch by any means.

Back to homepage

item.title: Travel
item.description:
Getting here

By car

Travelling by car will provide the easiest access to Cherhill, with limited parking available at St James’ Church and Cherhill Village Hall. There is some on-street parking on adjacent streets. Due to the limited parking, we’d ask that, when travelling on the day, you share cars wherever possible.

By public transport

Train services to Chippenham and Swindon are frequent and reliable. Getting from those train stations to Cherhill is sadly neither. There are some local buses but those passing through Cherhill are very infrequent. It’s likely to be easier to arrange private transport i.e. taxi or lift sharing from a nearby town.
